reviews.title: Good value for the location
Good room for a reasonable price
reviews.text: We stayed at the Atlantis Copacabana Hotel for 3 nights in July 2012. We found this hotel to be one of the cheaper options in Rio. but we were happy with the room and the service given price we paid. We arrived at the hotel around 6am after an overnight flight. We didn't expect our room to be available so early in the morning but they let us wait/sleep in the reception area. To our surprise our room was ready within an hour and a half (I guess after a guest had checked out early, and the cleaners had started work). The room was basic, a reasonable size with a desk and storage cupboard and air conditioning. The bathroom was a little cramped, but everything was clean and tidy. Breakfast was a a large buffet - only 2 cereals to choose from, but a range of bread and spreads, fruit juices, hot food and cakes, hot drinks etc. The hotel is a short 5-10 min walk to Copacabana beach and about 10mins to Ipenema. There are a few restaurants and a supermarket within 5 mins walk of the hotel. The staff were professional and helpful when arranging taxis and tours for us. I recommend others to stay here and would stay here again myself.
Location of the hotel is great. Close to ipanema and close to Copacabana.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for five nights which was probably too long considering the small room we were given (it was of of those rooms ending in a 5 or 6). With the air con unit right next to the bed - it acted as a sort of bed-side table, being on the same level. Sleeping with this thing rattling all night would have been impossible, so the bedroom soon became stuffy. Still, the bed was comfortable, the water was hot in the morning (but not in the evening) and the room fairly clean, though our visit to the beach meant that the sand which returned with us, remained on the floor throughout our stay. Sadly, the overworked chambermaids didn't thoroughly clean the rooms during our stay, the empty shampoo bottles remained in the shower and toilet paper was not always replaced. Bring shower gell is none is offered.
reviews.title: A bog standard budget hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast was good, though as in most places, somewhat dull after a few days. The room does feel crowded as there is no daylight but the choice is perfectly reasonable, good enough selection of fruit (I wouldn't call it 'awsome') and enough tables for the guests without having to share. I didn't find the reception too unfriendly, but I guess that what happens after living in Paris for 15 years! Certainly, when I commented on the work being done around the reception desk (new tiles were being laid, the staff reacted by replying that the hotel was full - presumably they thouight that I was asking to change rooms! The hotel iincidently was NOT full. I did appreciate the free computer access available to guests in the foyer, though two computers are not always enough.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: Would I stay here again? Possibly, yes. This is because of its excellent location, something not to be sniffed at in Rio. Close to the two best beaches, taxi ranks and shops, good restaurants and in a very safe neighbourhood this hotel is also quite cheap by Rio's standards. I wouldn't consider the place in most other cities in the world, but unfortunately Rio can demand such high prices due to limited choice in this beautiful but somewhat dated city.
reviews.title: Mix of good and bad in Rio!

reviews.text: This hotel is located at the end of Copacabana, bordering Ipanema which is a great location. The front desk were very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious as was the bathroom. Breakfast was nice. I was only there for a night having already spent a week in Rio at a different hotel. If I knew then what I now know I would have booked this hotel instead for the week.
reviews.title: Good value for Rio
